question: Q: What is Twitter?
answer: A: Twitter is a service for friends, family, and coworkers to communicate and stay connected through the exchange of quick, frequent messages. People post Tweets, which may contain photos, videos, links, and text. These messages are posted to your profile, sent to your followers, and are searchable on Twitter search. Learn more about how to use Twitter.

question: Q: Do I need anything special to use it?
answer: A: All you need to use Twitter is an internet connection or a mobile phone. Join us here! Once you're in, begin finding and following accounts whose Tweets interest you. We'll recommend great accounts once you're signed up.

question: Q: What's a Tweet?
answer: A: A Tweet is any message posted to Twitter which may contain photos, videos, links, and text. Click or tap the Tweet button to post the update to your profile. Read our Posting a Tweet article for more information.

question: Q: How can I send updates to Twitter?
answer: A: Read our article about how to post a Tweet. You can Tweet from twitter.com, a mobile device, or an application.

question: Q: What's a Retweet?
answer: A: A Retweet is a Tweet that you forward to your followers.

question: Q: How do I post a picture to Twitter?
answer: A: Uploading and sharing images on Twitter is easy! Find step-by-step instructions and FAQs on how to post a picture on Twitter.

question: Q: How can I enable dark mode?
answer: A: To enable dark mode via twitter.com, click on your profile photo, then select Dark mode from the menu. To disable the setting, simply click on Dark mode again. Dark mode is also available on Twitter for iOS and Twitter for Android.

question: Q: Who reads my updates?
answer: A: Your followers read your Tweets. If your Tweets are public, anyone who runs a search for a keyword in your Tweet may be able to see that message. Your Tweets are public by default; if you're hesitant to have people you may not know read your updates, protect your Tweets to approve followers and keep your updates out of search.

question: Q: Why can't I see all my Tweets? Are they lost?
answer: A: We store all your Tweets. Navigate to your profile to view up to 3,200 of your most recent Tweets in your profile timeline. To view more, you can download your Twitter Archive and browse a snapshot of your Twitter information, starting with your first Tweet.
